Naser Kazemi

Computer Engineering Student, Sharif University of Technology, Tehran, Iran

CV

About Me

I am a final-year Computer Engineering student at Sharif University of Technology, minoring in Applied Mathematics. My focus is on Machine Learning, especially Foundation Models, specifically World Models, and Reinforcement Learning. Over the past two summers, I have completed two research internships. The latest was at INSAIT in Sofia, under the supervision of Prof. Danda Paudel and Prof. Luc Van Gool, where I focused on developing World Models for interactive video generation. The other internship was at the Max Planck Institute for Informatics, supervised by Prof. Vahid Babaie, where I worked on multi-objective optimization.
